newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: SAfrica Rovic mine on first step to recovery.
newsitem.headline: SAfrica Rovic mine on first step to recovery.

text.p: The first phase of a recovery programme at South Africa's Roberts Victor Diamond Mine (Rovic), site of a recent lethal mine diaster, has begun, the mine's managers said on Monday.

Vancouver-listed Botswana Diamondfields Inc said the first phase of the plan will seek to secure the main and sub-vertical shaft access to the mine and also install a replacement dewatering system to prevent flooding at the main shaft bottom.

Late last month an inflow of mud from old open cast workings into the underground shafts killed 19 miners and a contract driller. The mine is based at Dealesville, 60 km from the Free State capital of Bloemfontein.
The firm said new pumps had been installed and the water level had dropped by more than 10 metres since pumping began on Sunday.
On the surface a contractor is injecting a chemical and cement grout into the old open workings to prevent any further mud or water inflow.
The firm said there were also plans to restore output at the mine and to re-establish a ventilation shaft and escape route at the south end of the mine.

In July the mine announced plans to raise production to 15,000 tonnes of kimberlite a month. "The opportunity now exists to re-examine this plan with the objective of achieving the same result a different way," the firm said.
It added that the new plan will seek to restore production with an underground lay-out which will allow the mining of at least three million tonnes of kimberlite over the mine's projected life-span.
